name: Hemingway - To-day is Friday
body:
Three Roman soldiers are in a drinking-place at
eleven oâclock at night. There are barrels
around the wall. Behind the wooden
counter is a Hebrew wine-seller. The
three Roman soldiers are a little cock-eyed.

1st Roman SoldierâYou tried the red?
2d SoldierâNo, I ainât tried it.
1st SoldierâYou better try it.
2d SoldierâAll right, George, weâll have a
round of the red.
Hebrew Wine-sellerâHere you are, gentlemen.
Youâll like that. [He sets down an
earthenware pitcher that he has filled from one
of the casks.] Thatâs a nice little wine.
1st SoldierâHave a drink of it yourself.
[He turns to the third Roman soldier who is
leaning on a barrel.] Whatâs the matter with
you?
3d Roman SoldierâI got a gut-ache.
2d SoldierâYouâve been drinking water.
1st SoldierâTry some of the red.
3d SoldierâI canât drink the damn stuff. It
makes my gut sour.
1st SoldierâYou been out here too long.
3d SoldierâHell, donât I know it?
1st SoldierâSay, George, canât you give this
gentleman something to fix up his stomach?
Hebrew Wine-sellerâI got it right here.

[The third Roman soldier tastes the cup
that the wine-seller has mixed for him.]

3d SoldierâHey, what you put in that,
camel chips?
Wine-sellerâYou drink that right down,
Lootenant. Thatâll fix you up right.
3d SoldierâWell, I couldnât feel any worse.
1st SoldierâTake a chance on it. George
fixed me up fine the other day.
Wine-sellerâYou were in bad shape, Lootenant.
I know what fixes up a bad stomach.

[The third Roman soldier drinks the cup
down.]

3d Roman SoldierâJesus Christ. [He makes
a face.]
2d SoldierâThat false alarm!
1st SoldierâOh, I donât know. He was
pretty good in there to-day.
2d SoldierâWhy didnât he come down off
the cross?
1st SoldierâHe didnât want to come down
off the cross. Thatâs not his play.
2d SoldierâShow me a guy that doesnât want
to come down off the cross.
1st SoldierâAw, hell, you donât know anything
about it. Ask George there. Did he
want to come down off the cross, George?
Wine-sellerâIâll tell you, gentlemen, I
wasnât out there. Itâs a thing I havenât taken
any interest in.
2d SoldierâListen, I seen a lot of themâhere
and plenty of other places. Any time
you show me one that doesnât want to get down
off the cross when the time comesâwhen the
time comes, I meanâIâll climb right up with
him.
1st SoldierâI thought he was pretty good in
there to-day.
3d SoldierâHe was all right.
2d Roman SoldierâYou guys donât know
what Iâm talking about. Iâm not saying
whether he was good or not. What I mean is,
when the time comes. When they first start
nailing him, there isnât none of them wouldnât
stop it if they could.
1st SoldierâDidnât you follow it, George?
Wine-sellerâNo, I didnât take any interest
in it, Lootenant.
1st SoldierâI was surprised how he acted.
3d SoldierâThe part I donât like is the nailing
them on. You know, that must get to you
pretty bad.
2d SoldierâIt isnât that thatâs so bad, as
when they first lift âem up. [He makes a lifting
gesture with his two palms together.] When
the weight starts to pull on âem. Thatâs when
it gets âem.
3d Roman SoldierâIt takes some of them
pretty bad.
1st SoldierâAinât I seen âem? I seen plenty
of them. I tell you, he was pretty good in there
to-day.

[The second Roman soldier smiles at the
Hebrew wine-seller.]

2d SoldierâYouâre a regular Christer, big
boy.
1st SoldierâSure, go on and kid him. But
listen while I tell you something. He was
pretty good in there to-day.
2d SoldierâWhat about some more wine?

[The wine-seller looks up expectantly.
The third Roman soldier is sitting with his
head down. He does not look well.]

3d SoldierâI donât want any more.
2d SoldierâJust for two, George.

[The wine-seller puts out a pitcher of
wine, a size smaller than the last one. He
leans forward on the wooden counter.]

1st Roman SoldierâYou see his girl?
2d SoldierâWasnât I standing right by her?
1st SoldierâSheâs a nice-looker.
2d SoldierâI knew her before he did. [He
winks at the wine-seller.]
1st SoldierâI used to see her around the
town.
2d SoldierâShe used to have a lot of stuff.
He never brought her no good luck.
1st SoldierâOh, he ainât lucky. But he
looked pretty good to me in there to-day.
2d SoldierâWhat become of his gang?
1st SoldierâOh, they faded out. Just the
women stuck by him.
2d Roman SoldierâThey were a pretty yellow
crowd. When they seen him go up there
they didnât want any of it.
1st SoldierâThe women stuck all right.
2d SoldierâSure, they stuck all right.
1st Roman SoldierâYou see me slip the old
spear into him?
2d Roman SoldierâYouâll get into trouble
doing that some day.
1st SoldierâIt was the least I could do for
him. Iâll tell you he looked pretty good to me
in there to-day.
Hebrew Wine-sellerâGentlemen, you know
I got to close.
1st Roman SoldierâWeâll have one more
round.
2d Roman SoldierâWhatâs the use? This
stuff donât get you anywhere. Come on, letâs
go.
1st SoldierâJust another round.
3d Roman Soldierâ[Getting up from the
barrel.] No, come on. Letâs go. I feel like
hell to-night.
1st SoldierâJust one more.
2d SoldierâNo, come on. Weâre going to
go. Good-night, George. Put it on the bill.
Wine-sellerâGood-night, gentlemen. [He
looks a little worried.] You couldnât let me
have a little something on account, Lootenant?
2d Roman SoldierâWhat the hell, George!
Wednesdayâs pay-day.
Wine-sellerâItâs all right, Lootenant. Good-night,
gentlemen.

[The three Roman soldiers go out the
door into the street.]
[Outside in the street.]

2d Roman SoldierâGeorge is a kike just like
all the rest of them.
1st Roman SoldierâOh, George is a nice
fella.
2d SoldierâEverybodyâs a nice fella to you
to-night.
3d Roman SoldierâCome on, letâs go up to
the barracks. I feel like hell to-night.
2d SoldierâYou been out here too long.
3d Roman SoldierâNo, it ainât just that.
I feel like hell.
2d SoldierâYou been out here too long.
Thatâs all.
Curtain.
